title: Mystery Gifted from Riot for Positive Attitude...
body:
What about for end of S5 we get a refund point for positive attitude instead from a Mystery Gift this time?

Or bad idea?

replies.body: we know you have something you bought that you didn't like xd

It was Elise since she was on sale...by far the most underwhelming champion I've played compared to how much hype I used to have for her...

But yeah, that lead me to the thought that it could probably be a season's reward for positive players...I can bet you a refund point is so much more appealing than a random Mystery Gift if Riot really wanted to 'promote' positive player attitude...

{{champion:268}} SHURIMA

I don't think you understand the primary reason Riot gave out a free mystery gift. It wasn't to reward positive play, if that's what you think.

Riot has found that giving away skins gets people into the habit of buying more skins. As such, the whole "free skin" is more likely than not just another way to promote the concept of buying skins, especially to the section of the market who hasn't bought a skin yet.

Essentially, the mystery gifts are a psychological way to MAKE Riot money, even though it looks like they're being generous. Giving a refund point will do the opposite of that, which is why Riot avoids doing such things as all costs.

The only reason Riot provided refund points to begin with was to avoid spamming of the customer support with requests, and to make it look like they're being "fair."

I think its a bad idea, it was not announced and it was a little thank you, idc if you guys say its a marketing strat, they where being nice, be grateful you even got anything, most companies dont care and would not give away anything. 

Be grateful with what you have
